data.title: Marbachegg – an excursion paradise
data.meta_description: Experience the excursion paradise of Marbachegg – from exciting mountain bike trails to picturesque hiking paths. ► Plan your trip now
data.text:
Panoramic hike: Marbachegg–Kemmeribodenbad

This hiking route first takes you past the picturesque reservoir in the direction of Ober Lochsitli, then crosses the idyllic paths to Wittenfären and Kadhus. Take the time to make a small diversion at the fork on the left and visit the alpine cheese dairy, where you can sample traditional local cheeses, or continue your hike directly to the cosy alpine pub. Your hiking trail continues via Oberhabchegg to the Lauizug and on to the Schibenhüttli. The challenging, stony path leads you via Ober and Unter Chemmeri to the Grosse Emme valley.

A culinary highlight of the hike awaits you at Landgasthof Kemmeriboden-Bad, where you should definitely try the famous Merängge, freshly cooked in a charcoal oven! After an eventful day, bus no. 251 will pick you up from the bus stop "Kemmeriboden" and take you safely and comfortably back to Marbachegg.

Key data

Walking route Marbachegg–Kadhus–Oberhabchegg–Kemmeribodenbad

Distance 8,1 km Walking time 2 hours 30 minutes Elevation difference Ascent: 227 m

Descent: 719 m Level of difficulty medium

Hiking map

Tip

Start your hiking excursion with an action-packed ride on the Marbachegg carts. It's worth it! On a wooden piste, you whizz across the alpine meadows of Marbachegg on three- or four-wheeled carts. The rapid descent demands full concentration. Afterwards, enjoy the breathtaking view while the ski lift takes you safely and comfortably back to Marbachegg.

Phenomenal views on the Marbachegg–Bumbach–Schangnau–Marbach hike

Your hike starts directly at the Berggasthaus (mountain inn) and takes you past the idyllic reservoir in the direction of Oberlochsitli and Wittenfärren. At the first crossroads after Oberlochsitli, keep right to get to Unterlochsitli. Shortly after leaving Unterlochsitli, you cross the cantonal border and enter the hilly landscape of the Emmental. Follow the well-signposted paths downhill to the Emme, where you can dip your feet in the refreshing, cool water. The hike continues along the Emme until you reach the Port area. There you cross the river again and continue towards Schangnau. Opposite Gasthof Löwen, follow the signpost to Kemmeriboden-Bad and continue along the Schonbach stream. This route takes you back to Marbach and the valley station of the Marbachegg sports lifts.

Key data

Walking route Marbachegg–Bumbach–Schangnau–Marbach

Distance 14 km Walking time 4 hours Elevation difference Ascent: 170 m

Descent: 770 m Level of difficulty medium

Shortcuts are available at the bus stops "Schangnau, Post", "Schangnau, Wald" or "Marbachegg, Talstation". The return journey is by bus no. 251 from the bus stop "Marbach LU, Post".

Hiking map

Tip

Visit the Arche-Hof Schangnau. An Arche-Hof is a facility where you can gain first-hand experiences of endangered farm animals and the methods used to conserve and support them.

Marbachegg also has plenty to offer little explorers.

Bretzeli Photo Orienteering (Bretzeli Foto-OL): a trail for the whole family on Marbachegg

Who doesn't know them, the delicious Kambly Bretzeli from Trubschachen! The delicious biscuits are also part of the Bretzeli Photo Orienteering Trail on Marbachegg. Equipped with the orienteering map, which is available at the mountain station, the whole family sets off in search of the photo posts on the sunny Marbachegg. Here you can find out exciting facts about the leisure activities on Marbachegg and about the popular Kambly Bretzeli. The Photo Orienteering Trail first leads down to the Seeli (little lake), where there is sure to be a post to snap. If you feel like it, you can also take a break here, as there is a great barbecue and picnic area by the reservoir. Continue in the direction of Gassenegg. Keep your eyes peeled, because in summer, funny marmots scurry around here! With a little luck and patience you can hear and see them. From here, follow the path through secluded forests back to Marbachegg.

Key data

Walking route Marbachegg–Speichersee–Gassenegg–Marbachegg

Distance 2.1 km Walking time approx. 1 hour Elevation difference Ascent: 100 m

Descent: 99 m Level of difficulty easy

Hiking map

Those who have found all 10 posts and correctly ticked off the orienteering map will receive a small surprise at the mountain or valley station. The Photo Orienteering Trail lasts around 60 to 90 minutes. The Bretzeli Photo Orienteering Trail is not suitable for pushchairs.

Tip

Plan enough time for a picnic! There are lovely barbecue spots along the way.

More family excursions

The Snowli Trail and the Food Trail offer further entertaining and educational ways to discover Marbachegg. And for the more adventurous, there are also exciting trails such as the Clientis Flowtrail and the CKW Jumptrail.

Explore the varied hiking options, ranging from short circular walks to special paths suitable for pushchairs. You can find all the information you need via the link below.

Family excursions on Marbachegg
